intro: Linaria pellicieriana, commonly known as the Pellicier's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its slender stems and narrow leaves are adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Linaria pellicieriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant floral display.
